title: Harz Nature Park
text:
The Harz (Lower Saxony) Nature Park () or just Harz Nature Park lies in the districts of <a href="Goslar%20%28district%29">Goslar</a> and <a href="G%C3%B6ttingen%20%28district%29">Göttingen</a> (in the area of the former <a href="Osterode%20am%20Harz%20%28district%29">Osterode am Harz</a> district) in <a href="South%20Lower%20Saxony">South Lower Saxony</a>. The nature park in the <a href="Harz%20Mountains">Harz Mountains</a> was founded in 1960 and is covers an area of around 790 km². It is run by the <a href="Harz%20Regional%20Association">Harz Regional Association</a>.
The nature park includes the <a href="Upper%20Harz">Upper Harz</a> minus the Lower Saxon parts of the <a href="Harz%20National%20Park">Harz National Park</a>. Its eastern and southeaster boundary is part of the <a href="German%20Green%20Belt">German Green Belt</a>. It borders on the <a href="Harz/Saxony-Anhalt%20Nature%20Park">Harz/Saxony-Anhalt Nature Park</a> to the east and the <a href="South%20Harz%20Nature%20Park">South Harz Nature Park</a> to the southeast, the entire Harz being a single, large protected area ("Großschutzgebiet").
In the Harz and thus in the nature park, which is characterised by a rich variety of <a href="flora">flora</a> and <a href="fauna">fauna</a>, are extensive forests, plateaus that are partly used by agriculture, deeply incised valleys with wild river courses and waterfalls, as well as <a href="storage%20pond">storage pond</a>s and <a href="reservoir">reservoir</a>s. In many places there are signs of a long history of settlement. In addition, there are winter sports areas and the Harz as a whole is a major hiking area.
The highest point in the Harz Nature Park (Lower Saxony) is the <a href="Wurmberg%20%28Harz%29">Wurmberg</a> ().
